intro: Symphyandra cretica subsp. samothracica, commonly known as the Samothracean symphyandra, is a rare and endemic plant species native to the Greek island of Samothrace. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its compound leaves and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows in rocky or coastal habitats, showcasing its adaptation to harsh environmental conditions. Its botanical features include a slender stem, finely divided foliage, and small white to pale yellow flowers that bloom in early summer. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
